article.title: ...Baby_One_More_Time_%28album%29

template.arg: {{Flatlist| * [[All Seeing I|The All Seeing I]] * [[Jörgen Elofsson]] * [[David Kreuger]] * [[Kristian Lundin]] * [[Per Magnusson]] * [[Max Martin]] * [[Rami Yacoub|Rami]] * Eric Foster White }}

''[[Oops!... I Did It Again (album)|Oops!... I Did It Again]]''
(2000)

article.paragraph: ...Baby One More Timeis the debutstudio albumby American recording artistBritney Spears. It was released on January 12, 1999, byJive Records. In June 1997, while Spears negotiated with managerLou Pearlmanto join female pop groupInnosense, her mother asked family friend and entertainment lawyerLarry Rudolphfor his opinion and submitted a tape of Spears singing over aWhitney Houstonkaraokesong. Rudolph decided to pitch her to record labels, sending them a demo tape with an unused song fromToni Braxton. Jive was interested and appointed the singer to work with producer Eric Foster White. After hearing the recorded material, Jive signed Spears to a multi-album deal.

Spears traveled to Sweden to work with producersMax Martin,Denniz PopandRami Yacoub, among others. Martin showed Spears and her management a track titled "Hit Me Baby One More Time", which was originally written for American R&B groupTLC (band)TLC; however, they rejected the track. Spears later claimed that she felt excited when she heard it and knew it was going to be a hit record. By June 1998, the album had been finished.

Critics gave the album mixed reviews, describing the singer as aMadonna (entertainer)Madonnanext door, considering it silly and premature. The album was successful on the charts, reaching the top five in several countries, while reaching number one in Canada and the United States. It also received several certifications around the world, including aRIAA certificationfourteen-times platinumcertification by theRecording Industry Association of America(RIAA), for shipments of over 14 million units in the country....Baby One More Timeis Spears' most successful album, selling over 30 million copies worldwide, making it one of theList of best-selling albumsbest-selling albums of all timeand the best-selling album by a teenage solo artist.

Five singles came from the album. "...Baby One More Time" became a worldwide success and one of theList of best-selling singles worldwidebest-selling singles of all time, at over ten million copies. The album was promoted with appearances on live television, and also by the...Baby One More Time Tourin 1999, with a second leg titled...Baby One More Time TourCrazy 2k Tourin 2000. Spears claimed she wasn't able to explore her vocal ability on the album. This album set Spears' internationalPop iconpop culture iconimage and launched her career. The album earned SpearsGrammynominations forBest New ArtistandBest Female Pop Vocal Performancefor "...Baby One More Time."
article.heading: Background and development

template.arg: "I had been in studio for about six months listening and recording material, but I hadn't really heard a hit yet. When I started working with Max Martin in Sweden, he played the demo for 'Baby One More Time' for me, and I knew from the start it one was of those songs you want to hear again and again. It just felt really right. I went into the studio and did my own thing with it, trying to give it a little more attitude than the demo. In 10 days, I never even saw Sweden. We were so busy."
—Spears talking to Chuck Taylor of ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''.{{cite journal |author

article.paragraph: In June 1997, Spears was in talks with managerLou Pearlmanto join female pop group Innosense. Lynne asked family friend and entertainment lawyer Larry Rudolph for his opinion and submitted a tape of Spears singing over a Whitney Houston karaoke song along with some pictures. Rudolph decided to pitch her to record labels, which required a professionaldemo (music)demo. He sent Spears an unused song from Toni Braxton; she rehearsed for a week and recorded in a studio with aAudio engineeringsound engineer. Spears traveled to New York with the demo and met executives from four labels, returning to Kentwood the same day. Three rejected her, arguing audiences wanted pop bands such as theBackstreet Boysand theSpice Girls, and "there wasn't going to be another Madonna, anotherDebbie Gibsonor anotherTiffany (American singer)Tiffany." Two weeks later, executives from Jive Records returned calls to Rudolph.harvnbHughes2005145Senior vice president ofArtists and repertoireA&RJeff Fenster stated, "It's very rare to hear someone that age who can deliver emotional content and commercial appeal. [...] For any artist, the motivationthe 'eye of the tiger' is extremely important. And Britney had that."cite journalCover Story: Britney Spears: Britney Spears : Rolling StoneApril 15, 1999Rolling Stone[[Jann Wenner]]DalySteven0035-791XThey appointed her to work with producer Eric Foster White for a month, who reportedly shaped her voice from "lower and less poppy" delivery to "distinctively, unmistakably Britney."harvnbHughes2005147Spears recorded ten songs with White, including "Autumn Goodbye", "E-Mail My Heart", "From the Bottom of My Broken Heart", "I'm So Curious", "I Will Still Love You", "Luv The Hurt Away", "Soda Pop", "Thinkin' About You", and "You Got It All"....Baby One More Timeliner notes.Jive Records(1999)The singer also recorded a cover ofSonny & Cher's 1967 single "The Beat Goes On (Sonny & Cher song)The Beat Goes On".White was responsible for the vocal recording and song production, while additional production was done by English electronic music groupAll Seeing I.

After hearing the material, presidentClive Calderordered a full album.Spears flew toCheiron StudiosinStockholm,Sweden, where half of the album was recorded from March to April 1998, with producers Max Martin, Denniz Pop and Rami Yacoub, among others.cite webhttp://www.rollingstone.com/artists/britneyspears/articles/story/5938512/cover_story_britney_spearsCover Story: Britney SpearsApril 15, 1999''[[Rolling Stone]]''. [[Jann Wenner|Wenner Media]]March 5, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20080505011004/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/britneyspears/articles/story/5938512/cover_story_britney_spearsMay 5, 2008Martin showed Spears and her management a track titled "Hit Me Baby One More Time", which was originally written for AmericanR&BgroupTLC (band)TLC; however, they rejected it. Spears later claimed that she felt excited when she heard it and knew it was going to be a hit.cite AV mediaE! Entertainment Special: Britney Spearshttp://www.imdb.com/title/tt0427200/Ray W. KeziahTV production[[E!]]2004-03-14https://web.archive.org/web/20120614153215/http://www.imdb.com:80/title/tt0427200/2012-06-14no"We at Jive said, 'This is a fuckin' smash'," revealed the label's A&R executive, Steven Lunt;harvnbKnopper200993however, other executives were concerned that the line "Hit Me" would condonedomestic violence, and later revised it to "...Baby One More Time".The singer revealed that she "didn't do well at all the first day in the studio [recording the song], I was just too nervous. So I went out that night and had some fun. The next day I was completely relaxed and nailed it. You gotta be relaxed singing '... Baby One More Time'."cite journalThe 500 Greatest Songs Since You Were Born - Blender[[Blender (magazine)|Blender]]Alpha Media GroupStaffBlender1534-0554By June 1998, the album was done,harvnbParish2002243and Spears embarked on a promotional tour sponsored byL'Oreal.harvnbBlandford200228...Baby One More Timewas released as Spears' debut album on January 12, 1999.harvnbBlandford200230
article.heading: Composition
article.paragraph: Spears had originally envisioned "Sheryl Crowmusic, but younger more adult contemporary", but felt all right with her label's producers, since "It made more sense to go pop, because I can dance to itit's more me."The album opens with the first single "...Baby One More Time (song)...Baby One More Time", ateen popanddance-popsong that begins with a three-notemotif (music)motifin the bass range of thepiano. The opening was compared to many other songs, such as "We Will Rock You" (1977), "Start Me Up" (1981) and the theme song of the filmJaws (film)Jawsdue to the fact the track "makes its presence known in exactly one second".cite webhttp://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtdVPE.asp?ppnBritney Spears Baby One More Time - Sheet MusicMusic Notes[[Alfred Music Publishing]]November 21, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20120225042903/http://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtdVPE.asp?ppn2012-02-25nocite webhttp://allmusic.com/album/baby-one-more-time-us-cd-single-r377377...Baby One More Time (US CD Single) - Britney Spears[[AllMusic]]. [[Rovi Corporation]]September 26, 2011April 20, 1999https://web.archive.org/web/20110513122455/http://www.allmusic.com:80/album/baby-one-more-time-us-cd-single-r3773772011-05-13noAccording to magazineBlender (magazine)Blender, "...Baby One More Time" is composed by "wah-wah (music)wah-wahguitar lines andelectrocardiographyEKG-machine bass-slaps".Claudia Mitchell and Jacqueline Reid-Walsh, authors ofGirl Culture: Studying girl culture : a readers' guide(2008), observed that the lyrics of the song "gesture toward [Spears] longing for the return of an ex-boyfriend."harvnbMitchellReid-Walsh2008547The next song and third single, "(You Drive Me) Crazy" runs through adown-tempomoderately slowdance musicdancebeat (music)beat,cite webhttp://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtdVPE.asp?ppnBritney Spears (You Drive Me) Crazy - Sheet MusicMusic Notes[[Alfred Music Publishing]]November 21, 2009http://www.webcitation.org/65yd4BgXB2012-03-07noand has aR&Brhythm and bluesmelodymixed with edgy synthesized instrumentals.harvnbBennettPetterson200492The third track and second single "Sometimes (Britney Spears song)Sometimes" is aBallad (music)ballad,cite webhttp://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2010/09/15/snooki-britney-spears/Snooki Lip-Synchs To Britney Spears' 'Sometimes'RyanChrisSeptember 15, 2010MTV. [[MTV Networks]]March 6, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20140312000909/http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2010/09/15/snooki-britney-spears/2014-03-12nothat Spears begins with "You tell me you're in love with me/That you can't take your pretty eyes away from me/It's not that I don't wanna stay/But every time you come too close I move away".cite webhttp://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtd.asp?ppnBritney Spears – Sometimes Sheet Music (Digital Download)Music Notes[[Alfred Music Publishing]]November 21, 2009https://web.archive.org/web/20130529192123/http://www.musicnotes.com:80/sheetmusic/mtd.asp?ppn2013-05-29noStephen Thomas ErlewineofAllMusicnoted the song has "a catchy hook and endearing melody, with a reminiscentEurodanceeuro-dancerhythm."cite webhttp://allmusic.com/album/baby-one-more-time-r384763/reviewBritney Spears ...Baby One More Time – Album ReviewJanuary 12, 1999ElerwineStephen Thomas[[AllMusic]]. [[Rovi Corporation]]April 2, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20111231041334/http://www.allmusic.com:80/album/baby-one-more-time-r384763/review2011-12-31no

After "Sometimes" is...Baby One More Time'sfourth track, "Soda Pop", a song that draws influences frombubblegum popanddancehall,cite webhttp://www.amazon.com/dp/b000023y30/Amazon.com: Baby One More Time (Import): Britney Spears: MusicMarch 15, 1999September 28, 2011[[Amazon.com]]and features background vocals from co-writer Mikey Bassie.Spears' vocals on the fifth track and fourth single, "Born to Make You Happy", span more than anoctave.cite webhttp://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtd.asp?ppnBritney Spears Born to Make You Happy – Digital Sheet MusicMusic Notes[[Universal Music Publishing Group]]December 23, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20090502034128/http://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtd.asp?ppn2009-05-02noIts lyrics allude to a relationship that a woman desires to repair, not quite understanding what went wrong, as she comes to realize that "I don't know how to live without your love/I was born to make you happy".cite webhttp://newsroom.mtv.com/2010/03/03/britney-spears-baby-one-more-time/Britney Spears Goes Back To Her Schoolgirl Days For The First Installment Of 'Popology'March 3, 2010AndersonKyleMTV. [[MTV Networks]]March 5, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131012024406/http://newsroom.mtv.com/2010/03/03/britney-spears-baby-one-more-time/2013-10-12noThe sixth track and final single, "From the Bottom of My Broken Heart", is a sentimental slow-tempoteen popballad.cite webhttp://new.music.yahoo.com/britney-spears/tracks/from-the-bottom-of-my-broken-heart--1486509From the Bottom of My Broken Heart by Britney SpearsYahoo! MusicMarch 4, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20110125223331/http://new.music.yahoo.com/britney-spears/tracks/from-the-bottom-of-my-broken-heart--14865092011-01-25nocite webhttp://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2009/09/28/vintage-video-britney-spears-flashback/Vintage Video: Britney Spears FlashbackRyan, ChrisSeptember 28, 2009MTV. [[MTV Networks]]December 25, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20131012045017/http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2009/09/28/vintage-video-britney-spears-flashback/2013-10-12nocite webhttp://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtdVPE.asp?ppnBritney Spears From The Bottom Of My Broken Heart – Digital Sheet MusicMusic Notes[[Universal Music Publishing Group]]November 15, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20120225042908/http://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtdVPE.asp?ppn2012-02-25no"I Will Be There" features a guitar riff similar toNatalie Imbruglia's "Torn (Natalie Imbruglia song)Torn" (1997), with a "rousing chorus about standing by your man (or a best friend or a house pet)", as noted by Kyle Anderson ofMTV. The eleventh track, "E-Mail My Heart", is a sensitive piano ballad where Spears sings, "E-mail me back/ And say our love will stay alive".The cover ofSonny & Cher's 1967 single "The Beat Goes On (Sonny & Cher song)The Beat Goes On" is influenced bybossa novaandtrip hop,cite webhttp://travel.canoe.ca/AllPop-SpearsBritney/cd_baby2.htmlBritney Spears' debut rather lacklusterStevensonJaneJanuary 17, 1999September 3, 2011[[Toronto Sun]]Mike Powerhttps://web.archive.org/web/20130608075458/http://travel.canoe.ca/AllPop-SpearsBritney/cd_baby2.html2013-06-08noand features a similar sound tospy filmspy moviesthemes.
article.heading: Critical reception
article.paragraph: ...Baby One More Timereceived mixed reviews from critics. Stephen Thomas Erlewine of Allmusic gave the album four out of five stars,cite web{{Allmusic|class...Baby One More Time[[AllMusic]]. [[Rovi Corporation]]Stephen ThomasErlewineJanuary 12, 1999November 13, 2008and commented that, by the time Spears launched her career, "everything old was new again", comparing the album toHangin' Tough(1988) byNew Kids on the Block.Erlewine further complimented the quality of the singles while praising Max Martin, "who is also the mastermind behind Spears' debut."Entertainment Weekly's Beth Johnson noted the singer "sounds remarkably like theBackstreet Boys' kid sister", saying, however, that this was "not surprising, since BSB hit-meister Max Martin wrote the candy-pop-with-a-funky-edge smash debut."cite webhttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,286184,00.html...Baby One More Time (1999)[[Entertainment Weekly]][[Time Warner]]BethJohnsonDecember 18, 1998November 13, 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20140222062802/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,286184,00.html2014-02-22noRobert Christgaucommented Spears portrayed a "Madonna next door" in the album with songs like "...Baby One More Time" and "Soda Pop",while Craig McDennis ofThe Hamilton Spectatorsaid the album "offers a glib compendium of soul/pop cliches, served with a giddy, uptempo verve that recallsDebbie Gibsonon a chocolate high."cite newshttp://travel.canoe.ca/AllPop-SpearsBritney/cd_baby1.htmlBopper babe's CD glib collection of clichesMcDennisCraigJanuary 12, 1999September 3, 2011[[The Hamilton Spectator]]Dana Robbinshttps://web.archive.org/web/20130608024858/http://travel.canoe.ca/AllPop-SpearsBritney/cd_baby1.html2013-06-08noAmazon.com's Rickey Wright gave...Baby One More Timea mixed review, saying that "a few of the disc's cuts are pleasantly catchy",noting, however, "neither does the 17-year-old Spears's debut album contain anything else that remotely approaches that instant hit single ['...Baby One More Time']."Billboard (magazine)Billboard's Paul Verna considered the album "a top 40-ready workout filled with hook-laden songs from the same bag as the title cut".cite journalhttps://books.google.com/books?idAlbumsJanuary 30, 1999[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]Nielsen Business Media, IncOctober 8, 2011VernaPaul0006-2510

Kyle Anderson ofMTVsaid he "was surprised in more ways than one "with his first listening of...Baby One More Time, commenting he "expected there to be a lot of filler (there sort of is), though I didn't expect it to be as odd (at least sonically) as it ended up being. There has never been any mystery to why Spears became such a superstar, but these songs probably would have been huge even if Britney wore burlap sacks in all of her videos."Barry Walters ofRolling Stonegave the album two stars out of five,and compared the album's sound to early hits of Debbie Gibson, Mariah Carey, andSamantha Fox.Walters also said that "while several Cherion-crafted kiddie-funk jams serve up beefy hooks, shameless schlock slowies, like 'E-Mail My Heart', are pure spam."ANMEreviewer rated...Baby One More Time1 out of 10, saying that "we seem to have reached crisis point: pubescent pop is now so rife that 17-year-old Britney 'lizard-lounge' Spears is already halfway through her lucrative showbiz career".cite webhttp://www.nme.com/reviews/britney-spears/853...Baby One More TimeMarch 6, 1999October 4, 2011[[NME]][[IPC Media]]https://web.archive.org/web/20131029201446/http://www.nme.com/reviews/britney-spears/8532013-10-29noHe also found the album premature, commenting, "hopefully, if she starts to live the wretched life that we all eventually do, her voice will show the scars, she'll stop looking so fucking smug, she'll find solace in drugs and we'll be all the more happier for it. Now grow up, girl. Quick!"Amanda Murray ofSputnikmusicfelt that, "with the exception of the terrific title track,...Baby One More Timeis a collection of either competent pop songs underwhelmingly executed or underwhelmingly written pop songs competently executed."cite webhttp://www.sputnikmusic.com/review/5825/Britney-Spears-...Baby-One-More-Time/Britney Spears - ...Baby One More Time (staff review)Murray, AmandaMarch 26, 2006SputnikmusicDecember 25, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20131029185644/http://www.sputnikmusic.com/review/5825/Britney-Spears-...Baby-One-More-Time/2013-10-29no
article.heading: Commercial performance

link.part: Spears performing "(You Drive Me) Crazy" during theDream Within a Dream Tour, 2001.

alt=Image of a blond female performer. She is turning her back to the camera, near the end of the stage. She is wearing black pants and a black top with long sleeves, showing her midriff. In front of her, a female dancer is climbing into a pole. A crowd of people clapping, screaming and taking pictures stands can be seen in the audience.

article.paragraph: ...Baby One More Timedebuted at the top of theBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200selling 121,000 units,cite webCraigRosenBritney Spears Debuts On Top; 'N Sync At No. 2January 20, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12040569http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT45JI5July 25, 2009noJuly 23, 2009replacingDMX (rapper)DMX'sFlesh of My Flesh, Blood of My Blood(1998).Spears broke several records by doing so.The singer became the first new female artist to have a number one single on theBillboardHot 100 and number one album on theBillboard200 at the same time;the first new artist (male or female) to have a single go to the number one spot the same week that the album debuted at number one;and the first new female artist to have the first single and first album at number one the same week.Spears is also the youngest female inBillboardhistory to have a simultaneous single and album at number one in the same week.cite webhttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12050537'99 REWIND: The Year Of Britney SpearsYahoo! Music NewsRosenCraigDecember 30, 1999December 28, 2012After four weeks since its release, the album had sold more than 500,000 copies, according toNielsen SoundScansales data.cite webCraigRosenBritney Spears Back On TopFebruary 10, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12063283May 10, 2011After dropping to the top five, the album went back to number one in its fourth week, with a total of 804,200 units sold.cite webCraigRosenBritney Still On Top, Offspring Up To No. 2, Cher In Top 10February 17, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12058414http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT4UvTRJuly 5, 2009noJuly 23, 2009On its fifth week it reached its highest sales week with 229,000 copies sold....Baby One More Timespent a total of six non-consecutive weeks at number one,and sold more than 1.8 million copies in its first two months of release in the country.cite webCraigRosenBritney Spears 'One More Time' AgainMarch 31, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12039233http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT6D4SqJuly 5, 2009noJuly 23, 2009In its 47th week on theBillboard200, the album held strong at number three, and with sales of over of 10 million copies in the United States alone.cite webCraigRosenBritney Spears Backstage At The 'Billboard Awards'December 10, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12046646http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT3MQGYJuly 25, 2009noJuly 23, 2009The album was later certified Diamond by theRecording Industry Association of America,making Spears the youngest artist to receive that award, breakingAlanis Morissette's record, who was 21 when she releasedJagged Little Pill(1995).cite webhttp://www.riaa.com/newsitem.php?content_selectorRecording Industry Announces 1999 Gold and Platinum Awards[[Recording Industry Association of America]]December 21, 1999October 5, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20120406112234/http://www.riaa.com/newsitem.php?content_selector2012-04-06noThe album was the fourteenth album since 1991 to sell over 10 million copies in the United States,cite webCaulfieldKeithUsher's 'Confessions' Album Hits 10 Million in U.S. Saleshttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/482065/ushers-confessions-album-hits-10-million-in-us-sales[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]][[Prometheus Global Media]]July 5, 2012https://web.archive.org/web/20130905220338/http://www.billboard.com:80/articles/news/482065/ushers-confessions-album-hits-10-million-in-us-sales2013-09-05noand Spears became the best-selling female artist of 1999....Baby One More Timespent a total of fifty-one weeks in the top ten of theBillboard200.cite webWendyHermansonBritney Spears Readies A Funky New AlbumJanuary 7, 2000Yahoo! Music Newshttp://ca.music.yahoo.com/read/news/12045573http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT6jJ9BJuly 5, 2009noJuly 23, 2009The album spent a total of 103 weeks on the chart.cite web{{BillboardURLbyName|artist...Baby One More Time Chart History[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]][[Prometheus Global Media]]1999October 5, 2011...Baby One More Timelanded at number three onBMGMusic Club all-time best-sellers list, selling 1.6 million units, behindShania Twain'sCome on Over (Shania Twain album)Come on Over(1997).cite webBarryDavidShania, Backstreet, Britney, Eminem and Janet Top All-Time SellersMusic Industry News NetworkFebruary 18, 2003http://www.mi2n.com/press.php3?press_nbMay 17, 2009http://www.webcitation.org/5jW8qIpnZSeptember 3, 2009no

The album debuted at number one on theCanadian Albums Chart, totaling nine non-consecutive weeks at the top.cite webCanadian Albums Chart[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]][[Prometheus Global Media]]http://www.billboard.com/charts/1999-01-30/canadian-albumsJanuary 30, 1999May 8, 2011cite webCanadian Albums Chart[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]][[Prometheus Global Media]]http://www.billboard.com/charts/1999-03-27/canadian-albumsMarch 27, 1999May 8, 2011cite webCanadian Albums Chart[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]][[Prometheus Global Media]]http://www.billboard.com/charts/1999-04-17/canadian-albumsApril 17, 1999May 8, 2011On December 12, 1999, theCanadian Recording Industry Associationcertified it Diamond, for sales over 1 million units.Certification Cite RefCanadaBaby One More TimeBritney Spearsalbum19991999yesSeptember 28, 2011...Baby One More Timespent two weeks at number two on theEuropean Top 100 Albums,and sold over four million copies within the continent, being certified quadruple platinum by theInternational Federation of the Phonographic Industry.Certification Cite RefEuropeBaby One More TimeBritney Spearsalbum2000yesSeptember 28, 2011The album reached number two in theUK Albums ChartUnited Kingdom,number four inSyndicat National de l'dition PhonographiqueFranceand was certified triple Platinum by theBritish Phonographic Industry,Certification Cite RefUnited KingdomBaby One More TimeBritney Spearsalbumdouble Platinum by theSyndicat National de l'dition Phonographique,Certification Cite RefFranceBaby One More TimeBritney SpearsalbumPlatinum220011999yesSeptember 28, 2011triple Gold in Germany by theInternational Federation of the Phonographic Industry,Certification Cite RefGermanyBaby One More TimeBritney Spearsalbumand ten-times Platinum (Diamond) by thePolish Society of the Phonographic Industry.Certification Cite RefPolandBaby One More TimeBritneySpearsalbumPlatinum11999...Baby One More Timedebuted at number nine in May 1999 on theARIA ChartsAustralian Albums Chart, reaching at number two nine weeks later, placing behind theDawson's Creek#Music''Dawson's Creek'' soundtrack.The album became the seventh highest-selling of 1999 in the country, and was certified four-times Platinum by theAustralian Recording Industry Associationthe following year after shipping 280,000 copies to retailers.cite webhttp://www.aria.com.au/pages/aria-charts-end-of-year-charts-top-100-albums-1999.htmAustralian Annual ChartAustralian Recording Industry Association1999July 19, 2009http://www.webcitation.org/5iPwC4TdxJuly 20, 2009noCertification Cite RefAustraliaBaby One More TimeBritney Spearsalbum2000yesSeptember 28, 2011The track debuted at number three in theRecording Industry Association of New ZealandNew Zealand, placing behind Shania Twain'sCome on OverandThe Corrs'.cite webhttp://www.rianz.org.nz/rianz/chart.aspNew Zealand Music Charts[[Recording Industry Association of New Zealand]]May 30, 1999July 13, 2009http://www.webcitation.org/5PkfqxTDFJune 20, 2007noAlbum Chart#1161The album was later certified triple Platinum in the country by theRecording Industry Association of New Zealand.Certification Cite RefNew ZealandBaby One More TimeBritney Spearsalbum1212
article.heading: Singles
article.paragraph: "...Baby One More Time (song)...Baby One More Time" was released as Spears' debut single on October 23, 1998.harvnbGaines199926The song received generally favorable critical reviews, mostly praising its composition."...Baby One More Time" attained worldwide success, reaching number one in every European country where it charted.cite webhttp://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?interpretBritney Spears – ...Baby One More Time - Charts Around the World[[ARIA Charts|ARIA Top 50 Singles]]. Hung MedienFebruary 28, 1999October 23, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20131106213415/http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?interpret2013-11-06noIt received numerous certifications around the world, and is one of theList of best-selling singles worldwidebest-selling singles of all time, at over ten million copies.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/6376213.stm[[BBC News]]BBCHow Disney's TV gang has grown upFebruary 20, 2007May 2, 2011http://www.webcitation.org/681DpNvXw2012-05-29noAn accompanying music video, directed byNigel Dick, portrays Spears as a student from aCatholic ChurchCatholichigh school, who starts todaydreamthat she is singing and dancing around the school, while watching her love interest from afar.cite webMTV. [[MTV Networks]]Britney Spears Shoots For Fun With Video DebutDecember 18, 1998http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1434423/19981218/spears_britney.jhtmlJuly 30, 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20100424051911/http://www.mtv.com:80/news/articles/1434423/19981218/spears_britney.jhtml2010-04-24yesIn 2010, the music video for "...Baby One More Time" was voted the third-most influential video in the history ofpop music.cite webhttp://jam.canoe.ca/Music/2010/05/03/13804931-wenn-story.html'Thriller' tops best video poll[[Jam!]]. [[Sun Media]]May 3, 2010May 2, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131219194309/http://jam.canoe.ca/Music/2010/05/03/13804931-wenn-story.html2013-12-19no

"Sometimes (Britney Spears song)Sometimes" was released as the second single on April 30, 1999.cite webhttp://www.britney.com/us/making-britstoryMaking BRITstoryBRITannicaOctober 3, 2011Britney.com. [[Sony Music Entertainment]]http://www.webcitation.org/65yd3VAWh2012-03-07no"Sometimes" achieved commercial success worldwide, reaching number one inUltratop 50Belgium (Flanders),Mega Single Top 100NetherlandsandRecording Industry Association of New ZealandNew Zealand,cite webhttp://hitparade.ch/showitem.asp?interpretBritney Spears – Sometimes Chart HistoryHung MedienMarch 2, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131105130017/http://hitparade.ch/showitem.asp?interpret2013-11-05nowhile peaking inside the top five in four countries.In the United States, "Sometimes" missed the top ten, peaking at number twenty-one on theBillboard Hot 100''Billboard'' Hot 100.cite webhttp://allmusic.com/artist/britney-spears-p320976/charts-awards/billboard-singlesBritney Spears Billboard ChartsSeptember 28, 2011[[AllMusic]]. [[Rovi Corporation]]https://web.archive.org/web/20120225042927/http://allmusic.com/artist/britney-spears-p320976/charts-awards/billboard-singles2012-02-25noThe music video for the song was directed by Nigel Dick.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1431411/will-smith-britney-spears-jennifer-lopez-star-wars-among-videos-set-debut.jhtmlWill Smith, Britney Spears, Jennifer Lopez, "Star Wars" Among Videos Set To DebutApril 29, 1999MTV. [[MTV Networks]]March 6, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131213135655/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1431411/will-smith-britney-spears-jennifer-lopez-star-wars-among-videos-set-debut.jhtml2013-12-13noDuring rehearsals, on February 11, 1999, Spears injured her left knee and needed surgery.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1434419/britney-spears-knee-injury-delays-video-shoot-tonight-show-appearance.jhtmlBritney Spears' Knee Injury Delays Video Shoot, "Tonight Show" AppearanceFebruary 18, 1999MTV. [[MTV Networks]]2013-12-10https://web.archive.org/web/20131213135652/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1434419/britney-spears-knee-injury-delays-video-shoot-tonight-show-appearance.jhtml2013-12-13noAfter recuperating inKentwood, Louisiana,the music video was shot on April 910, 1999 at Paradise Cove inMalibu, California.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/photos/mtv-buzzworthy-blog-best-of-britney/1649473/5296696/photo.jhtmlBritney shooting 'Sometimes' video in April 1999MTV. [[MTV Networks]]October 6, 2010February 7, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131213135657/http://www.mtv.com/photos/mtv-buzzworthy-blog-best-of-britney/1649473/5296696/photo.jhtml2013-12-13noIt was released on May 6, 1999, onMTV'sTotal Request Live.

In May 1999, Max Martin and Spears went to the Battery Studios inNew York City, New York, to re-record the vocals of "(You Drive Me) Crazy",cite AV media notesLiner notes(You Drive Me) Crazy [The Stop! Remix]1999Britney SpearsJive Records0550672due to the fact that a remixed version called "The Stop! Remix" was going to be included on the original motion picture soundtrack of the filmDrive Me Crazy(1999).cite webhttp://www.amazon.com/dp/B00001O2UFAmazon.com: Drive Me Crazy (1999 Film): Various Artists - Soundtracks: MusicSeptember 28, 1999September 28, 2011[[Amazon.com]]"The Stop! Remix" of the song was released as the third single on August 23, 1999.The music video was directed by Nigel Dick, and featured actorsMelissa Joan HartandAdrian Grenier.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1626386/director-recalls-making-britney-spears-drive-me-crazy-video.jhtmlBritney Spears Wanted '(You Drive Me) Crazy' Video To Take Her 'To The Next Level'VenaJocelynNovember 16, 2009April 24, 2011MTV. [[MTV Networks]]https://web.archive.org/web/20130921075354/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1626386/director-recalls-making-britney-spears-drive-me-crazy-video.jhtml2013-09-21no

"Born to Make You Happy" was released on December 6, 1999, as the fourth single,cite webhttp://www.swedishcharts.com/showitem.asp?interpretSwedishcharts.com – Britney Spears – Born to Make You Happy[[Ultratop]] & Hung Medien / hitparade.chMarch 5, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20140408043502/http://swedishcharts.com/showitem.asp?interpret2014-04-08noand received mixed reviews from music critics.cite webhttp://www.musicomh.com/albums/britney-spears.htmPetch-JexAndyBritney Spears - Greatest Hits: My Prerogative - Album ReviewNovember 8, 2004musicOMHMarch 5, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20110629103633/http://www.musicomh.com/albums/britney-spears.htm2011-06-29yesThe song achieved commercial success, peaking inside the top-five in eleven countries.The music video for it was directed byBillie Woodruffand produced by Geneva Films,cite videoSpears, BritneyNovember 9, 2004Greatest Hits: My PrerogativeDVDZomba/Jive Label Grouphttp://www.imdb.com/title/tt0480109/February 4, 2011B00064AM62https://web.archive.org/web/20140421095631/http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0480109/2014-04-21nochoreographed byWade Robson.cite webhttp://www.msaagency.com/waderobson/Wade Robson, Producer/Director/ChoreographerMcDonald / Selznick AssociatesMay 7, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131004213142/http://www.msaagency.com/waderobson/2013-10-04no

"From the Bottom of My Broken Heart" was released on December 15, 1999, as the final single.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1431167/britney-spears-announce-tour-with-lfo.jhtmlBritney Spears To Announce Tour With LFOJohnson, TineDecember 8, 1999MTV. [[MTV Networks]]February 4, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131213062631/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1431167/britney-spears-announce-tour-with-lfo.jhtml2013-12-13noThe song also received mixed reviews, finding the song a classic hit and competent single, despite considering it as an unremarkable song that refers only to kissing."From the Bottom of My Broken Heart" achieved moderate success, peaking at number thirty-seven in Australia, and twenty-three in New Zealand.cite webhttp://www.australian-charts.com/search.asp?searchAustralian-charts.com – Britney Spears – From the Bottom of My Broken Heart[[ARIA charts|ARIA Top 50 Singles]]. Hung MedienNovember 15, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20140202190223/http://australian-charts.com/search.asp?search2014-02-02noThrough imports, the song reached one hundred seventy-four in the United Kingdom.cite webhttp://www.zobbel.de/UK Chart History - Searchable DatabaseMarch 11, 2000The Official Charts CompanyZobbelApril 24, 2011http://www.webcitation.org/6ILagTUK82013-07-24noIn the United States, "From the Bottom of My Broken Heart" reached number fourteen onBillboardHot 100, and seventeen on Pop Songs,cite journal2000Hot 100 Spotlight[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]1129108[[Prometheus Global Media]]0006-2510https://books.google.com/?idDecember 25, 2010and was later certified Platinum by theRecording Industry Association of America(RIAA) on March 28, 2000, for selling over 1,000,000 physical units of the single.cite webhttp://riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpageRIAA certification searchable database - "Britney Spears"[[Recording Industry Association of America]]March 28, 2000November 15, 2010The music video, directed byGregory Dark, was released on December 17, 1999.It was highly criticized due to the fact that Dark had previously directed porn films.cite webhttp://www.laweekly.com/2000-02-10/music/the-devil-in-miss-spears/The Devil in Miss SpearsBemisAlec HanleyFebruary 10, 2000[[LA Weekly]]Beth SestanovichMarch 1, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131013225403/http://www.laweekly.com/2000-02-10/music/the-devil-in-miss-spears/2013-10-13nocite webhttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,84970,00.htmlX Marks the ShotSeymourCraigFebruary 4, 2000''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''. [[Time Inc.|Time Inc]]March 1, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20131004214309/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,84970,00.html2013-10-04no
article.heading: Promotion

link.part: Spears performing "...Baby One More Time (song)...Baby One More Time" duringThe Circus Starring Britney Spears, 2009.
alt=A blond female performer. She is standing on a moving jungle gym, wearing black and white clothes.

article.paragraph: Promotion began in 1998, when Spears did a small tour in malls and food courts that were located mostly in larger cities around the United States. Each show lasted around 30 minutes, and Spears had two female dancers with her on the stage. The promo tour is also known as the L'Oreal Mall Tour, after its sponsor.The singer made several promotional appearances including talk shows and live performances around the world. On December 1998, Spears' first showed up on MTV's and the Box's most-requested video charts.cite webWendyHermansonBritney Spears: New Teen Queen?December 22, 1998Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12050778http://www.webcitation.org/5iXSx3oMAJuly 25, 2009noJuly 23, 2009She also appeared on theRicki Lake (TV series)Ricki Lake Show, theHowie Mandel Show, and was the presenter of the 1999American Music Awards of 1999American Music Awards, prior to the release of the album.The singer also appeared on MTV'sSpring Breakand on the 100th episode ofNickelodeon'sAll That.However, after hurting her knee, she had rescheduled appearances several shows such asThe Tonight Show with Jay LenoandLive with Regis and KellyLive With Regis And Kathie Lee.cite webCraigRosenBritney Spears Sidelined With Bum KneeMarch 4, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12049598http://www.webcitation.org/5iXSzFdBaJuly 25, 2009noJuly 23, 2009After recovering, Spears embarked on another promotional schedule. The singer appeared on Nickelodeon's 12th Annual Kids Choice Awards on May 1, MTV'sFANaticon May 12,Live With Regis & Kathie Leeon May 3, andThe Rosie O'Donnell Showon May 25.cite webCraigRosenBritney Spears Ready To Hit The RoadApril 9, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12032891http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT096NqJuly 25, 2009noJuly 23, 2009

Outside the United States, Spears visited German talk showWetten, dass..?andTop of the Popson June 25, 1999.She also went to the United Kingdom, making appearances on programmes such asThis Morning (TV series)This Morning,CD:UKandNational Lottery (United Kingdom)National Lottery.She visited a music variety show calledHey! Hey! Hey! Music Champin Japan, and performed at the Festival Bar in Italy.Spears was also featured on an episode ofAmerican Broadcasting CompanyABCtelevision sitcom,Sabrina, The Teenage Witch, where she played herself.cite webCraigRosenBritney Spears: In Drag And On TVAugust 4, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12045032http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT18ZsFJuly 25, 2009noJuly 23, 2009Spears was returning a favor to actressMelissa Joan Hart, who played a cameo role in Spears' video for "(You Drive Me) Crazy," according toPeoplemagazine.The episode aired on September 24, 1999.The same month, Spears performed onThe Rosie O'Donnell Showon September 27, and visitedCarson Dalyon MTV'sTotal Request Livethe following day.cite webCraigRosenBritney Spears Is All Over TVSeptember 24, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12041209http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT1eIZlJuly 25, 2009noJuly 23, 2009She had a mini-Disneyconcert titled "Britney Spears & Joey McIntyre In Concert." Spears andJoey McIntyreperformed live in the taped concert event.cite webCraigRosenNirvana, Paul McCartney, And Britney Spears In Today's TV TipsOctober 16, 1999Yahoo! Music Newshttp://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12039519http://www.webcitation.org/5iXT2EcjjJuly 25, 2009noJuly 23, 2009Promotion for the album continued in early 2000, where Spears performed at theAmerican Music Awards of 2000,and also performed "From the Bottom of My Broken Heart" in a medley with "...Baby One More Time" at the2000 Grammy Awards.
article.heading: Touring
article.paragraph: Main...Baby One More Time Tour(You Drive Me) Crazy TourOn March 5, 1999, it was reported that Spears was planning her first headlining tour.cite newshttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,1099891_0_274628_6,00.htmlBubble Gum Blows Up!March 5, 1999December 31, 2009EssexAndrewKargerDaveBaldwinKristen[[Entertainment Weekly]][[Time Warner]]https://web.archive.org/web/20131019071816/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,1099891_0_274628_6,00.html2013-10-19noShe announced that the tour would start in July.cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/1434415/britney-spears-back-in-action-plans-summer-tour/Britney Spears Back In Action, Plans Summer TourMarch 23, 1999December 31, 2009StaffMTV NewsMTV. [[MTV Networks]]On May 12,Tommy Hilfigerwas announced as the main tour sponsor. During the time of the announcement, Spears was being featured in the company's "AllStars" campaign.cite press releaseTommy Hilfiger Announces Sponsorship of Britney Spears Summer Concert Tourhttp://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0EIN/is_1999_May_12/ai_54609972/Business WireMay 12, 1999July 17, 2010On December 17, during the premiere of the music video of "From the Bottom of My Broken Heart" onTotal Request LiveTRL, Spears called the show to announce March 2000 US tour dates. The extension, entitled Crazy 2K Tour, was considered a prelude to herOops!... I Did It Again World Tourfuture world tour.cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1434396/19991217/spears_britney.jhtmlBritney Spears Phones "TRL" To Announce U.S. Tour DatesDecember 17, 1999January 1, 2010BashamDavidMTV. [[MTV Networks]]https://web.archive.org/web/20010626083309/http://www.mtv.com:80/news/articles/1434396/19991217/spears_britney.jhtml2001-06-26yescite journalThe Girl Can't Help ItMay 25, 2000[[Rolling Stone]][[Jann Wenner]]MundyChris0035-791XThe leg's main sponsor wasGot Milk?. Media director Peter Gardiner explained, "Britney is magic with teen-age girls, and that's an absolutely crucial target for milk". Spears shot an advertising campaign to be shown before her performances began.cite newshttp://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-60047306/milk-producers-back-britney.htmlMilk producers back Britney Spears tourMarch 6, 2000January 16, 2010ThompsonStephanie[[Advertising Age]][[Crain Communications Inc.]]The secondary sponsor wasPolaroid CorporationPolaroidand the corporation released theI-ZonePolaroid I-Zoneas the tour's official camera. Spears used the I-Zone onstage to take pictures of the audience and further promote the product.cite newshttp://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-61398528.htmlPolaroid and Britney Spears Will Drive You CrazyApril 7, 2000January 16, 2010ReporterPR Newswire[[PR Newswire]]https://web.archive.org/web/20120225042944/http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-61398528.html2012-02-25yesThe show was divided into segments, separated by interlude, ending with an encore.The setlist consisted of songs from her debut album and severalcover versioncovers.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?fThe musical equivalent of cotton candyJuly 30, 1999January 1, 2010GanahlJane[[San Francisco Chronicle]][[Hearst Corporation]]https://web.archive.org/web/20110629055854/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f2011-06-29noSome changes were made during the 2000 leg, with the covers replaced by songs from her second studio album,Oops!... I Did It Again (album)Oops!... I Did It Again. The tour received positive critical appreciation.cite newshttp://jam.canoe.ca/Music/Artists/S/Spears_Britney/1999/07/10/749831.htmlSpears takes aim at fameJuly 10, 1999January 1, 2010StevensonJane[[Jam!]][[Quebecor Inc.]]https://web.archive.org/web/20131013010943/http://jam.canoe.ca/Music/Artists/S/Spears_Britney/1999/07/10/749831.html2013-10-13noDuring the tour, Spears was accused of lip synching, although she denied these claims.On April 20, 2000, the concert atHilton Hawaiian VillageinHonolulu, Hawaii, was taped.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idSpears special to include concertApril 15, 2000January 18, 2010ReporterThe Tuscaloosa News[[The Tuscaloosa News]][[The New York Times Company]]It was slightly altered from its Crazy 2K incarnation and featured different costumes. On June 5, 2000, it was broadcast onFox Broadcasting CompanyFox.cite newshttp://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/54798682.html?didsFOR FOX, IT'S GAMES - FOR BRITNEY, IT'S ALOHAJune 5, 2000January 22, 2010AbbottJim[[Orlando Sentinel]][[Tribune Company]]The special was aired several times during the year. On November 21, 2000, Jive Records released theLive and More!DVD, which included the Fox special.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idBritney Spears 'Stronger'November 10, 2000January 18, 2010ReporterBillboard[[The Herald Journal]]Pioneer NewspapersIt was certified triple platinum by the RIAA for shipping 300,000 units.cite webhttp://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpageBritney Spears - Live and More![[Recording Industry Association of America]]November 15, 2001January 22, 2010
article.heading: Impact
article.paragraph: Quote box30%left"With ''...Baby One More Time'', I didn't get to show my voice off. The songs were great, but they weren't very challenging."—Spears reflects on ''...Baby One More Time'' in December 1999.{{cite news | titleSpears was credited with leading the revival ofteen pop.The Daily Yomiurireported that "critics have hailed her as the most gifted teenage pop idol for many years, but Spears has set her sights a little higher-she is aiming for the level of superstardom that has been achieved by Madonna and Janet Jackson."cite newsTeen pop idols stage comebackYomiuri Shimbun1November 25, 1999Rolling Stonewrote: "Britney Spears carries on the classic archetype of the rock & roll teen queen, the dungaree doll, the angel baby who just has to make a scene."cite journalOops!...I Did It Again2000Rolling Stone[[Jann Wenner]]0035-791XRami Yacoub who co-produced Spears's debut album with lyricist Max Martin commented, "I know from Denniz Pop and Max's previous productions, when we do songs, there's kind of a nasal thing. With N' Sync and the Backstreet Boys, we had to push for that mid-nasal voice. When Britney did that, she got this kind of raspy, sexy voice."cite bookBronsonFredThe Billboard book of number 1 hitsBillboard Books2003377978-0-8230-7677-2Chuck Taylor ofBillboardobserved, "Spears has become a consummate performer, with snappy dance moves, a clearly real-albeit young-and funkdified voice ... "(You Drive Me) Crazy", her third single ... demonstrates Spears' own development, proving that the 17-year-old is finding her own vocal personality after so many months of steadfast practice."cite newsTaylorChuckBritney Spears: (You Drive Me) CrazyBillboard1113527August 28, 1999Stephen Thomas Erlewine of Allmusic referred to her music as a "blend of infectious, rap-inflected dance-pop and smooth balladry."Sputnikmusic writer Amanda Murray noted the album "offers a marker for Spears' progression as an artist, as a celebrity, and as a woman."

Spears became an internationalpop iconpop culture iconimmediately after launching her recording career.Rolling Stonemagazine wrote: "One of the most controversial and successful female vocalists of the 21st century," she "spearheaded the rise of post-millennial teen pop ... Spears early on cultivated a mixture of innocence and experience that broke the bank".cite webBritney Spears: Biography: Rolling StoneRolling StoneJann Wenner2008http://www.rollingstone.com/music/artists/britney-spears/biographyAugust 9, 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20131112115709/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/artists/britney-spears/biography2013-11-12noShe is listed by theGuinness World Recordsas having the "Best-selling album by a teenage solo artist".cite bookFolkardClaireGuinness World Records 2003Bantam Books2003288978-0-553-58636-7Melissa Ruggieri of theRichmond Times-Dispatchreported, "She's also marked for being the best-selling teenage artist. Before she turned 20 in 2001, Spears sold more than 37 million albums worldwide".cite newsRuggieriMelissaMusic Notes[[Richmond Times-Dispatch]]D.13December 19, 2000Barbara Ellen ofThe Observerhas reported: "Spears is famously one of the 'oldest' teenagers pop has ever produced, almost middle aged in terms of focus and determination. Many 19-year-olds haven't even started working by that age, whereas Britney, a former Mouseketeer, was that most unusual and volatile of American phenomena  a child with a full-time career. While other little girls were putting posters on their walls, Britney was wanting to be the poster on the wall. Whereas other children develop at their own pace, Britney was developing at a pace set by the ferociously competitive American entertainment industry".cite newsEllenBarbaraComment: Britney Spears: Growing up is hard to do: America's apple- pie cheerleader is feeling the pressure as she tries to break free from her clean teen image. So is it all proving too much for Britney Inc, as she pulls out of tonight's Smash Hits Poll Winners' party and takes to her bed: The Observer Profile: Britney Spears[[The Observer]]27December 10, 200000297712...Baby One More Timeis Spears' most successful album to date, with worldwide sales over 30 million copies,cite newshttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/4723158/With-dreams-in-her-heart.htmlWith dreams in her heartThe Daily TelegraphApril 28, 2001http://www.webcitation.org/6Dp9ONifU2013-01-21noand also the best-selling album by a teenage solo artist.Folkard, Claire (2003).Guinness World Records 2003. Bantam Books. p. 288. ISBN 978-0-553-58636-7.

list.listitem: In North America the album was issued as an Enhanced CD that allowed access to bonus videos, photos and more when inserted into a computer.

The very first pressings of the album feature a hidden spoken message by Spears after "The Beat Goes On". In it, Spears thanks fans and promotes the then-upcomingBackstreet Boysalbum,Millenniumwith snippets of songs featured on the album.
